result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley M Sberna was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
BAIL APPLIED OF $276.00. Balance of Fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation to Count 3.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

BAIL APPLIED TO DNA AND BLOOD COSTS.
Blood costs will be forwarded to the City of Brookfield Police Dept.

With Huber. Credit for 1 day.
FORTHWITH.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Attendance to Victim Impact Panel on 11/02/2016; or serve 30 days huber consecutive.
Follow through with AODA Assessment as well, if not ready done so.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration but IS eligible
for Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
Do not operate unless you are properly licensed.
No contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint.
